sentences: Ta kannab suuri rõõmusid kogu aeg.
context: The word 'kannata' is an Estonian verb that means to bear, endure, or put up with something difficult or unpleasant. It can refer to enduring physical discomfort, emotional hardship, or challenging circumstances. The word appears in different forms depending on the subject and tense - for example, 'kannab' (he/she/it endures), 'kannavad' (they endure).
